One Punch-Man  
Add to reading list  Add to wish list  Add to:
Description [Edit]
In this new action-comedy, everything about a young man named Saitama screams "AVERAGE," from his lifeless expression, to his bald head, to his unimpressive physique. However, this average-looking fellow doesn't have your average problem... He's actually a superhero that's looking for tough opponents! The problem is, every time he finds a promising candidate he beats the snot out of them in one punch. Can Saitama finally find an evil villain strong enough to challenge him? Follow Saitama through his hilarious romps as he searches for new bad guys to challenge!

Note:
- One Punch-Man is the remake of the original webcomic.
- Nominated for the 7th annual Manga Taishou Award.

User Comments [ Order by usefulness ]
 
 Stops being a remake by chapter 47   
Rating: N/A
by goaway
November 25th, 2016, 12:35am
Not really a review but I wanted to inform potential and current readers that the manga starts going it's own route from chapter 47 and they also add a lot more story and character screen time that isn't present in the original. I started thinking that the alteration in story may have been done in order to allow the original to receive more chapters but looking at the current chapter of the original (108 as of writing), I don't think this manga will keep story on the same path. It will be interesting to see the outcome of the current arc of this manga when we will actually find out what has changed and what has remained the same.

The manga is excellent nevertheless and the action never dulls down. The bonus added screen time for the manga's characters is one of it's more subtle charms that isn't present in the original. Though quite honestly, the remake may have shifted away from the qualities that were present before chapter 47.

I'm already feeling that much of the spirit that was present in the original may have been lost for good in the remake, especially the gags, so I suggest reading the original too.
Was this comment useful?  Yes   No     Report 
 How to kill Saitama?   
Rating: N/A
by saberzone
October 17th, 2016, 11:53am
He seems immortal, but I stumble upon this video at youtube (This is how to kill Saitama One Punch Man! 1 Minute Anime Theory) http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8PYoLg5uG6o . It said that Saitama is lucky when he fight Boros, he should be killed in the space.

Anyway, this is a very good series and fun to read. Everything is balanced and the jokes is natural

 Boring   
Rating: 6.0 / 10.0
by Gekkoh
August 4th, 2016, 4:54pm
ONE's version is far better. The redrawn version is full of cliche and stereotypical characters. The story lost a lot of its charm and uniqueness and became just another story about superheroes.
Was this comment useful?  Yes   No     Report 
 Surprised by how good this can be.   
Rating: N/A
by wansmor
July 29th, 2016, 10:02pm
Although it's based on a very same series of other I love the way this is going. I like the way the artist keep the protagonist's look from the original, I always feel that he is so out of character (in terms of art).

Art is definitely good, it's actually very good, and the story is also great. I initially hesitate to pick this one up, because, well I thought it will be lame if the protagonist just take down his opponent with one blow, but surprisingly the author find a way to work around that. All in all it makes good story. It's also very funny at times. The only down side is the rate of release. It's very slooooooow.
Was this comment useful?  Yes   No     Report 
 Great Humour   
Rating: 8.0 / 10.0
by ayanora
March 16th, 2016, 4:42pm
Really good as a gag manga, but I guess, since the stakes aren't high enough, the plot kind of loses its impact. (have not read all the volumes yet, probably challenging monsters appear later?)
Well, more like, there are no stakes at all. While Saitama IS ridiculously overpowered, since it's because of his hard work, so it's done in a sympathetic manner.
Though it seems that only Saitama's hard work has paid off, while the other heroes who probably train just as hard are left in the dust. At some point, even the monsters become sympathetic due to the fact that they stand no chance. At. All.
So while it's great as comedy, sometimes apart from the sheer impact of the action scenes, the motivations and stakes really don't add up. It seems really superficial. And while one-shotting everything is hilarious, it's almost insulting to the struggles of the rest of the cast.
btw saitama has great villain potential. Would 100% read if he were villain!
Was this comment useful?  Yes   No     Report 
 Simply Put   
Rating: 10.0 / 10.0
by Polka-Dotted-Yoshi
January 14th, 2016, 3:50pm
This is one of the best manga I've ever feasted my eyes on. The action scenes from the artwork are breathtaking, possibly even better than the actual animation's.

While some chapters drag, the comedy never fails to make me laugh and brighten my day.

 Best protagonist   
Rating: N/A
by Pebble_
January 6th, 2016, 3:18pm
Best protagonist ever.
And the story is fast and awesome. The redrawn version definitely adds something tand it's quite faithful to ONE's version.

Only thing I really dislike in this version is the way they draw the female characters, ESPECIALLY Fubuki. She's way too sexualized and she looks weak and annoying. In ONE's version she's badass and interesting. It's a big big waste of a good female chara in a story that lacks a bit in this department.

But still, great story, recommended.

Read the first chapter and you will be sold.
Was this comment useful?  Yes   No     Report 
 Love it!!   
Rating: 10.0 / 10.0
by Muses
August 3rd, 2015, 12:04am
My favorite part about this manga is that..
Every single character, even the backgrounds, have so much detail and are unique, having their own distinct feature that sets them apart from other characters...
EXCEPT the main character.
The dynamic between Saitama's abilities and his appearance and personality make the manga more interesting entertaining along with the comedic aspects.
The story and the art are easy to follow along.
It's the type of manga I wouldn't mind re-reading several times.

... Last updated on August 3rd, 2015, 12:10am
